title: Is it safe to say that if 9 people report someone in a game they'll get suspended?
body:
I had a Jinx today who was abusing the living sh*t out of the enemy team and barely cooperating with our own. As soon as she stole a kill that would have resulted in a Pentakill, I told my Premades as well as the enemy team to just report her for 'Negative Attitude' and serve some justice for once.

I'm hoping she'll get suspended for it, but I was wondering if copping that many reports in one match would almost be an auto-suspension?

replies.body: It doesn't matter if 1 person or 9 people in a match report you, the outcome will be the same. If punishment is called for, it will get handed out, if the reports were false, all reporting players will have a strike against them for false reporting. As long as you have nothing to hide, you've got nothing to worry about.
You can't get reported for stealing a pentakill. but, if like 2 of those 9 Summoners gave like a few sentences on what the jinx was doing them I'm sure she would get reported.

Nah, the guy was being a blatant tosspot all game in all-chat. Both teams were sorta pissed off at/ignoring her. Her stealing the penta was just was triggered me telling everyone to report the annoying b*tch (including my 2 premade teammates so she got no less than 3 reports, but probably 9).

when riot can see the chat to see how this Jinx was abusing Summoners. Then Riot might ban her or just warn her depending how bad she was being abusive. (I'm not interested in the chat send a ticket to riot they will solve it, also I believe I'm not allowed to know this information without the Jinx herself letting me see it.)
If the report is actually called for i guess it's possible.
Reporting never works as far as  i know
